Camera Focus Examples

This example demonstrates how to use the camera focus checking functionality in the Unlook SDK.

Basic Focus Check

basic_focus_check.py
 1#!/usr/bin/env python3
 2# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
 3
 4from unlook import UnlookClient
 5import time
 6import cv2
 7
 8def main():
 9    # Create client with auto-discovery
10    client = UnlookClient(auto_discover=True)
11    print("Starting scanner discovery...")
12    client.start_discovery()
13
14    # Wait for discovery
15    time.sleep(5)
16
17    # Connect to first available scanner
18    scanners = client.get_discovered_scanners()
19    if not scanners:
20        print("No scanners found. Please check that scanner is powered on.")
21        return
22
23    print(f"Connecting to scanner: {scanners[0].name}")
24    client.connect(scanners[0])
25
26    # Get available cameras
27    cameras = client.camera.get_cameras()
28    if not cameras:
29        print("No cameras found on the scanner.")
30        return
31
32    # Check focus for each camera
33    for camera in cameras:
34        camera_id = camera["id"]
35        print(f"Checking focus for camera {camera_id}...")
36
37        # Check focus with multiple samples
38        score, quality, image = client.camera.check_focus(camera_id, num_samples=5)
39        print(f"Camera {camera_id} focus score: {score:.2f}, Quality: {quality}")
40
41        # Display the image with focus information
42        if image is not None:
43            # Create a copy for drawing
44            display_img = image.copy()
45
46            # Add focus information
47            cv2.putText(display_img, f"Focus: {score:.2f} - {quality}",
48                       (30, 30), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 1, (0, 255, 0), 2)
49
50            # Show the image
51            cv2.imshow(f"Camera {camera_id}", display_img)
52            cv2.waitKey(0)
53            cv2.destroyAllWindows()
54
55    # Disconnect from scanner
56    client.disconnect()
57    print("Disconnected from scanner")
58
59if __name__ == "__main__":
60    main()

Interactive Focus Adjustment

interactive_focus.py
  1#!/usr/bin/env python3
  2# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  3
  4from unlook import UnlookClient
  5import time
  6import argparse
  7
  8def parse_roi(roi_str):
  9    """Parse region of interest string to tuple."""
 10    if not roi_str:
 11        return None
 12
 13    try:
 14        parts = roi_str.split(',')
 15        if len(parts) != 4:
 16            print(f"Invalid ROI format: {roi_str}. Expected 'x,y,width,height'")
 17            return None
 18
 19        roi = tuple(int(part) for part in parts)
 20        return roi
 21    except ValueError:
 22        print(f"Invalid ROI values: {roi_str}. Expected integers")
 23        return None
 24
 25def main():
 26    # Parse command line arguments
 27    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Camera Focus Adjustment Tool')
 28    parser.add_argument('--stereo', action='store_true',
 29                       help='Check focus for stereo camera pair')
 30    parser.add_argument('--camera-id', type=str, default=None,
 31                       help='Specific camera ID to check (for single camera mode)')
 32    parser.add_argument('--roi', type=str, default=None,
 33                       help='Region of interest for focus check (x,y,width,height)')
 34    parser.add_argument('--timeout', type=int, default=5,
 35                       help='Discovery timeout in seconds')
 36    args = parser.parse_args()
 37
 38    # Parse ROI
 39    roi = parse_roi(args.roi)
 40    if args.roi and roi is None:
 41        return 1
 42
 43    # Create client with auto-discovery
 44    client = UnlookClient(auto_discover=True)
 45    print("Starting scanner discovery...")
 46    client.start_discovery()
 47
 48    # Wait for discovery
 49    print(f"Waiting {args.timeout} seconds for scanner discovery...")
 50    time.sleep(args.timeout)
 51
 52    # Connect to first available scanner
 53    scanners = client.get_discovered_scanners()
 54    if not scanners:
 55        print("No scanners found. Please check that scanner is powered on.")
 56        return 1
 57
 58    print(f"Connecting to scanner: {scanners[0].name}")
 59    client.connect(scanners[0])
 60
 61    try:
 62        if args.stereo:
 63            # Stereo camera focus check
 64            print("Starting interactive stereo focus check")
 65            print("Adjust camera focus until both cameras show GOOD or EXCELLENT")
 66            print("Press Ctrl+C to exit when focus is good")
 67
 68            client.camera.interactive_stereo_focus_check(
 69                roi=roi,
 70                interval=0.5
 71            )
 72        else:
 73            # Single camera focus check
 74            camera_id = args.camera_id
 75
 76            if camera_id is None:
 77                # If no camera ID specified, use first available
 78                cameras = client.camera.get_cameras()
 79                if not cameras:
 80                    print("No cameras found on the scanner.")
 81                    return 1
 82                camera_id = cameras[0]["id"]
 83
 84            print(f"Starting interactive focus check for camera {camera_id}")
 85            print("Adjust camera focus until it shows GOOD or EXCELLENT")
 86            print("Press Ctrl+C to exit when focus is good")
 87
 88            client.camera.interactive_focus_check(
 89                camera_id=camera_id,
 90                roi=roi,
 91                interval=0.5
 92            )
 93
 94    except KeyboardInterrupt:
 95        print("Focus check interrupted by user")
 96    finally:
 97        # Final focus check
 98        if args.stereo:
 99            results, _ = client.camera.check_stereo_focus(num_samples=5, roi=roi)
100            for camera_id, (score, quality) in results.items():
101                print(f"Final camera {camera_id} focus: {score:.2f}, Quality: {quality}")
102        else:
103            score, quality, _ = client.camera.check_focus(camera_id, num_samples=5, roi=roi)
104            print(f"Final camera {camera_id} focus: {score:.2f}, Quality: {quality}")
105
106        # Disconnect from scanner
107        client.disconnect()
108        print("Disconnected from scanner")
109
110    return 0
111
112if __name__ == "__main__":
113    exit(main())

Running the Examples

To run these examples:

  1. Ensure you have installed all required dependencies:

    pip install -r client-requirements.txt

  2. Connect your Unlook scanner hardware and ensure it’s powered on

  3. Run the basic focus check:

    python basic_focus_check.py

  4. Run the interactive focus adjustment:

    # For a single camera
python interactive_focus.py

# For stereo cameras
python interactive_focus.py --stereo

# With a region of interest
python interactive_focus.py --stereo --roi 640,360,200,200

Advanced Usage Notes

  • For the best focus check results, use a target with fine details or text

  • The ROI feature is useful when your scene has varying depths, allowing you to focus on a specific area

  • In stereo setups, it’s important that both cameras are equally well-focused

  • After achieving good focus, ensure any locking rings on the camera lenses are tightened without changing the focus position
